subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] my opinion on the mini box
author: Lisby
full_text:
Rod-- I think you've missed out, buddy. I've had loving relationships  
with spirit entities for decades. Too bad one never came your way. It  
might make you feel differently about blanket statements like "'being  
a friend' is not on their list of priorities! That goes for all of  
them." My own three decades of involvement with contact with the  
Other Side--and I have also been ghost hunting many years before it  
became a fad--that they are fully capable of loving interaction, and  
do so on a regular basis if they so choose.

Ann


On Nov 15, 2007, at 6:42 PM, erick hunter wrote:

>
> Bruce,  the boxes aside,  I am talking about Ghosts, period.  The  
> boxes are for simple communication,  not inter-acting.  When I say  
> "inter-acting" I don't mean trade a few words,  I'm referring to  
> Meaningful interaction.  Making a Statement,  passing on a message  
> to me or a living relative,  predicting or causing "physical"  
> inferances.   I've experienced every kind of Ghost,  I feel  
> certain,  all over the world.  I have experience with them that  
> most people just dream about...or fear.  I have been carressed,   
> molested,  poked,  probed,  slapped,  punched,  knocked down and  
> physically Picked Up by a Ghost.  I have confronted them face-to- 
> face while they were both visible and invisable.  I have numerous  
> times held conversations with them via voice recorder and once even  
> one-on-one (it was the experience of a life-time!).  I was Hunting  
> Ghosts many, many years before it became a fad,  or cool to do so.   
> And,  believe me,  I am far from being an "expert".  I do not  
> presume on Ghosts or their personalities.  Every time in the past  
> that I've done so,  I've been rocked back on my heels,   
> psychologically speaking. Some are good,  some are not.  Many of  
> them very much enjoy making you the fool (that's a lot easier done  
> with some people than are others!) .
> It doesn't matter in the slightest what you Think of them,  They  
> are what they are,  and "being a friend" is definitely not on their  
> list of priorities!  That goes for All of them.  They will play  
> with you.  They will lie to you.  They will tell, or imply to you,  
> what they know you want to hear,  that or they will laugh at you.   
> I have personally heard their laughter,  on more than one  
> occasion.  The first step in beginning to understand Ghosts is to  
> quit watching stupid TV Ghost Dramas,  and learn to be discernful  
> aboutReality.  God bless, anyway.        --Rod
>

> Rod,
>
> No disrespect but how do you know what ghosts have
> the where with all to do? I speak with them through frank and joe's  
> box on a daily basis and consider the
> two that are communicating daily to be friends. I believe you are  
> speaking of grounded spirits not etherals
> and ghosts that are grounded most definately interact with us.  
> residual ghosts and hauntings do not that is why
> there is a distinction between the two intelligent and residual  
> hauntings. but we are not talking generaly about
> haunting spirits that communicate through frank and joe's boxes,  
> but all types of entities and don't call anyone
> dillusional unless you yourself have experienced your own research  
> with the boxes.
>
> Bruce

>
> I certainly agree with the point of Bruces' statement,  but I fear  
> he's being delusional about "friends" from the other side affecting  
> some inter-action between a box and the user,  not letting one  
> work,  the box chosing it's owner,  etc., etc., etc.  In the first  
> place Ghosts are Not our Friends!  That's pure, unadulterated Fantasy.
> The Ghosts do not have the where-with-all to accomplish this in the  
> first place, and even if they did they don't give a rats' rear end  
> what a Ghost Hunter does or doesn't do.  That boy really needs to  
> get real.  Ghosts simply do not re-act to the living in that way,  
> or much of any other way except to allow us to see or hear them and  
> then only when they want it to happen.  Their most obvious and  
> biggest trait is to be totally indifferent to our wishes.   Over 40  
> yrs. of Investigating the Paranormal has taught me nothing if it  
> hasn't taught me this.      --Rod
>
>
>  velazquez <ghostchasingfool@...> wrote:
> Here, here Bruce.  I am glad others who a genuine support my  
> outlook, I couldn't agree more!
>
> bhali333 <paranormalinvestigating@hotmail.com> wrote:
> since I dropped the bomb about this mini box to Frank s. yesterday I
> did not expect such a fervent hoopla about it.So I will give my box
> experienced opinion after lengthy research with both Frank's and
> Joe's boxes. I have contacted the manufacturer for an explanation, he
> instructed me to listen to the audio file and view the demo video on
> his site. After doing so my opinion on this box and the builders
> intentions for it is.
>
> The box itself is not a knock off of Frank's box but a cheap and
> ineffective version of Joe's box,It works on an AM band instead of an
> FM band as Joe's box does. Another big difference is Joe's box
> actually works and you have all heard the files I have posted from
> sessions with it. After listening to this box and seeing it in
> operation I feel that anyone who purchases this box will be very
> disappointed and will not receive any contact from it and even if
> they did they probably would not even realise it for the simple fact
> that you have to have a certain amount of experience with box
> research and operation before developing an ear for picking up real
> time communication and also creating a bond with the spirit friends
> on the other side and also a measure of trust on both sides.
>
> I believe the manufacturer to be a capitalist and only interested in
> the monetary reward to be gained from offering this cheap and
> ineffective copy to unsuspecting and naive individuals who are
> interested in this medium. I do not like to bad mouth anyone, it
> usually comes back to bite you in the ass but I believe that our
> friends on the other side know of our intentions and would not allow
> someone with the wrong intentions to develop a working tool for
> communication. also I believe that a person does not pick the box the
> box picks the person.
>
> So let him have his short and lucrative run with this fooling
> unsuspecting clients, bad karma always comes home.
>
> Bruce
